Procedure.string: Soak chilies, ginger, and garlic with vinegar and 1/2 tsp salt for 20 min
Heat a frying pan over high heat. Add cloves, cumin seeds, cinnamon, and pepper. Dry toast for 40 seconds, then add to the soaking chilies.
Add this mixture and the onions to a blender to create a puree. This mixture is known as vindaloo masala
Heat the oil in a heavy saucepan over high heat and fry the p ort for 3-4 minutes to seal. Add the vindaloo masala.
Rinse the blender with a bit of water and add to the pork
Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium and cook for 40 minutes, until pork is tender.

Notes.string: Used 10 peppers and only confident to have removed about 80% of seeds, too spicy. Knock it down to 6 on the next run. Flavor is great when spice is not overpowering it
